intro: Eremanthus pinnatifidus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eremanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Eremanthus pinnatifidus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas.
